intro: Isocarpha alternifolia, commonly known as the alternate-leaved isocarpha, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features alternate leaves that are lanceolate and often hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a capitulum, typical of the daisy family. Isocarpha alternifolia is typically found in grasslands and open habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
